title: 110_s1475
content: The Act titled "Bay Area Regional Water Recycling Program Authorization Act of 2007" authorizes the Mountain View, Moffett Area Reclaimed Water Pipeline Project under the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act. The Act authorizes the Mountain View, Moffett Area Reclaimed Water Pipeline Project with a 25% federal cost share and a $5,000,000 appropriation. No funds are provided for project operation and maintenance. The Act authorizes the Pittsburg Recycled Water Project with a 25% federal cost share and a $1,400,000 appropriation. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the City of Pittsburg, California, and the Delta Diablo Sanitation District. No funds are provided for project operation and maintenance. The Act authorizes the Antioch Recycled Water Project with a 25% federal cost share and a $2,250,000 appropriation. The Secretary can participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the City of Antioch, California, and the Delta Diablo Sanitation District. No funds are provided for project operation and maintenance. The Act authorizes the North Coast County Water District Recycled Water Project with a 25% federal cost share and a $2,500,000 appropriation. The Secretary can participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities. No funds are provided for project operation and maintenance. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of the Redwood City Recycled Water Project with a 25% federal cost share. Funds for project operation and maintenance are not provided. $1,100,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of the South Santa Clara County Recycled Water Project with a 25% federal cost share. Funds for project operation and maintenance are not provided. $7,000,000 is authorized for this project. Additionally, the South Bay Advanced Recycled Water Treatment Facility is also mentioned. The Secretary, in cooperation with the City of San Jose, California, and the Santa Clara Valley Water District, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water treatment facilities with a federal cost share not exceeding 25%. Funds for project operation and maintenance are not provided. $8,250,000 is authorized for this purpose. The Congress authorizes various recycled water projects in different areas such as Mountain View, Pittsburg, Antioch, Redwood City, and others. Additionally, there is a specific mention of the San Jose Area water reclamation and reuse project authorized by section 1607 of the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992. The Secretary, in cooperation with the City of San Jose and the Santa Clara Valley Water District, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water treatment facilities with a federal cost share not exceeding 25%. $8,250,000 is allocated for this purpose.
